title: John Chapter 21 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on John chapter 21 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: John Chapter 21 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of John Chapter 21.

questions.question: Where did Jesus show himself again to the disciples after his resurrection?
questions.correctAnswer: Sea of Tiberias
questions.explanation: Jesus showed himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias as stated in John 21:1.

questions.question: Which disciple said, 'I go a fishing'?
questions.correctAnswer: Simon Peter
questions.explanation: Simon Peter told the others, 'I go a fishing' according to John 21:3.

questions.question: How many fish did Simon Peter's net contain when they pulled it to land?
questions.explanation: The net was full of 153 great fishes as described in John 21:11.

questions.question: What did Jesus tell the disciples to do with the net?
options: Cast it on the right side of the ship
Cast it on the left side of the ship
questions.correctAnswer: Cast it on the right side of the ship
questions.explanation: Jesus instructed them to cast the net on the right side of the ship in John 21:6.

questions.question: Who recognized that it was the Lord standing on the shore?
questions.correctAnswer: The disciple whom Jesus loved
questions.explanation: The disciple whom Jesus loved told Peter, 'It is the Lord' in John 21:7.

questions.question: What were the disciples doing when Jesus appeared to them by the sea?
questions.correctAnswer: Fishing
questions.explanation: They had gone fishing but caught nothing during the night as mentioned in John 21:3.

questions.question: What did Jesus have prepared on the shore when the disciples arrived?
options: A fire of coals with fish and bread
questions.correctAnswer: A fire of coals with fish and bread
questions.explanation: Jesus had a fire of coals with fish and bread laid on it as described in John 21:9.

questions.question: How many times did Jesus ask Simon Peter if he loved Him?
questions.correctAnswer: Three times
questions.explanation: Jesus asked Simon Peter three times if he loved Him in John 21:15-17.

questions.question: What did Jesus tell Simon Peter to do after asking if he loved Him?
options: Feed my lambs and feed my sheep
questions.correctAnswer: Feed my lambs and feed my sheep
questions.explanation: Jesus instructed Peter to feed His lambs and sheep after each question about love in John 21:15-17.

questions.question: What did Jesus say would happen to Simon Peter when he was old?
options: Another will gird him and carry him where he would not go
He will live a long life
questions.correctAnswer: Another will gird him and carry him where he would not go
questions.explanation: Jesus foretold Peter's death and that another would carry him where he did not want to go in John 21:18.

questions.question: Who was following Peter, whom Jesus loved?
options: The disciple who leaned on Jesus' breast at supper
questions.correctAnswer: The disciple who leaned on Jesus' breast at supper
questions.explanation: This disciple followed Peter and was the one who leaned on Jesus' breast as per John 21:20.

questions.question: True or False: The disciples knew at first that it was Jesus standing on the shore.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The disciples did not know it was Jesus when He first stood on the shore according to John 21:4.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus told Peter to follow Him regardless of what happens to the other disciple.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jesus told Peter, 'If I will that he tarry till I come, what is that to thee? follow thou me' in John 21:22.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus ate with the disciples when He appeared to them at the sea of Tiberias.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jesus invited the disciples to dine with Him and ate bread and fish with them in John 21:12-13.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'Simon Peter saith unto them, I go a ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: fishing
questions.explanation: Simon Peter said, 'I go a fishing' as found in John 21:3.

medium.title: John Chapter 21 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from John Chapter 21 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A believer feels discouraged after working hard but seeing no results. Based on John 21, what biblical truth encourages persistence in obedience?
options: Obey Jesus' instruction even when results seem absent
Give up and try a different profession
Ignore Jesus and rely on your own strength
Keep fishing only during the night
questions.correctAnswer: Obey Jesus' instruction even when results seem absent
questions.explanation: In John 21:3-6, the disciples caught nothing all night but obeyed Jesus' command to cast the net on the right side and then caught many fish, teaching trust and obedience in God's timing.

questions.question: How does Jesus' repeated question to Peter about love in John 21 teach us about restoration after failure?
options: It shows Jesus' willingness to restore and reaffirm relationships
It punishes Peter for his past denial
It ignores Peter's love and moves on
It demands proof of Peter's love through works
questions.correctAnswer: It shows Jesus' willingness to restore and reaffirm relationships
questions.explanation: John 21:15-17 reveals Jesus asking Peter three times if he loves Him, restoring Peter after his denial and commissioning him to care for His followers, emphasizing grace and restoration.

questions.question: A fellow believer is uncertain about following Jesus' call amid challenges. What lesson from John 21 supports perseverance in discipleship?
options: Jesus tells Peter to follow Him despite future suffering
Jesus advises Peter to avoid difficulties
Jesus says to wait for others to lead
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus tells Peter to follow Him despite future suffering
questions.explanation: John 21:18-19 shows Jesus predicting Peter's difficult future but still commanding him to follow, teaching commitment and perseverance regardless of hardship.

questions.question: What does the miraculous catch of fish in John 21 teach about work ethic and trusting God's provision?
options: Faithful work with God's guidance brings fruitful results
Fishing is the only way to provide
Success comes only from human effort
Ignore God's instructions and rely on luck
questions.correctAnswer: Faithful work with God's guidance brings fruitful results
questions.explanation: John 21:6 and 11 describe how obeying Jesus' direction led to a large catch despite previous failure, showing the importance of trusting God while working diligently.

questions.question: How does the fellowship meal with Jesus in John 21 illustrate Christian community and hospitality?
options: Sharing food with Jesus demonstrates fellowship and care
Meals should be eaten alone for spiritual growth
questions.correctAnswer: Sharing food with Jesus demonstrates fellowship and care
questions.explanation: In John 21:9-13, Jesus prepares a meal for the disciples, symbolizing intimate fellowship and the importance of communal sharing in the church.

questions.question: A believer struggles with doubt about their love for Christ. How does Peter's response to Jesus' questions in John 21 encourage honesty in faith?
options: Peter openly affirms his love, showing honest confession is important
questions.correctAnswer: Peter openly affirms his love, showing honest confession is important
questions.explanation: John 21:15-17 records Peter honestly confessing his love for Jesus each time, teaching the value of sincere self-examination and confession in relationship with Christ.

questions.question: What biblical principle about stewardship can be learned from Jesus' instruction to bring the caught fish to Him in John 21?
options: We should offer the fruits of our labor back to God
Keep all your earnings for yourself
questions.correctAnswer: We should offer the fruits of our labor back to God
questions.explanation: Jesus commands the disciples to bring the fish they caught (John 21:10-11), illustrating the principle of presenting our work and resources as an offering to God.

questions.question: How does Jesus' commission to Peter to 'Feed my sheep' in John 21 relate to serving others in the church?
options: It commands believers to care for and support fellow Christians
It means only pastors should serve
questions.correctAnswer: It commands believers to care for and support fellow Christians
questions.explanation: John 21:15-17 shows Jesus entrusting Peter to shepherd His followers, teaching all believers to serve and support the church community.

questions.question: True or False: According to John 21, Jesus appeared to His disciples three times after His resurrection.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 21:14 states this is the third time Jesus showed Himself to His disciples after His resurrection, confirming multiple post-resurrection appearances.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus told Peter that another disciple would never die according to John 21.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 21:23 clarifies Jesus did not say the disciple would never die, but said 'If I will that he tarry till I come, what is that to thee?' correcting a misunderstanding.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: When Jesus asked Peter, 'Lovest thou me more than ___?' Peter replied, 'Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee.'
questions.correctAnswer: these
questions.explanation: In John 21:15 Jesus asks Peter if he loves Him more than 'these' (the other disciples), and Peter affirms his love, showing personal devotion above peers.

questions.question: What lesson about humility can we learn from Peter's action upon recognizing Jesus on the shore in John 21?
options: Peter humbly puts on his fisher's coat and jumps into the sea
Peter ignores Jesus and continues fishing
Peter criticizes Jesus for being late
questions.correctAnswer: Peter humbly puts on his fisher's coat and jumps into the sea
questions.explanation: John 21:7 shows Peter immediately preparing and acting to meet Jesus, demonstrating humility and eagerness to follow despite past failures.

questions.question: How does John 21 emphasize the importance of bearing faithful testimony as a Christian witness?
options: The beloved disciple testifies to the truth of these things
Believers should keep their faith private
questions.correctAnswer: The beloved disciple testifies to the truth of these things
questions.explanation: John 21:24 states the disciple who testifies and wrote these things confirms their truth, encouraging believers to bear faithful witness to the Gospel.

questions.question: What guidance about contentment can be drawn from the large net full of fish that was not broken in John 21?
options: God provides abundantly without loss when we obey Him
God does not care about our work
questions.correctAnswer: God provides abundantly without loss when we obey Him
questions.explanation: John 21:11 describes the net full of 153 fish that was not broken, symbolizing God's abundant provision and care over our labor when we follow His guidance.

questions.question: According to John 21, how should believers respond to questions about others' spiritual destinies, such as 'Lord, what shall this man do?'
options: Focus on following Jesus personally rather than comparing others
questions.correctAnswer: Focus on following Jesus personally rather than comparing others
questions.explanation: John 21:21-22 shows Jesus telling Peter to follow Him and not worry about others' destinies, teaching personal responsibility in discipleship.

hard.title: John Chapter 21 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from John Chapter 21.

questions.question: In John 21:6, Jesus instructs the disciples to cast their net on which side of the ship to catch fish?
questions.correctAnswer: Right side
questions.explanation: Jesus specifically tells the disciples to cast the net on the right side of the ship, resulting in a large catch of fish (John 21:6).

questions.question: What is the significance of Peter girding his fisher's coat before jumping into the sea in John 21:7?
options: It shows his readiness to work
questions.correctAnswer: It indicates he was naked
questions.explanation: The text notes that Peter girded his fisher's coat because he was naked, highlighting his urgency to reach Jesus (John 21:7).

questions.question: In John 21:15-17, Jesus asks Peter three times if he loves Him. What literary device is used in this triple repetition?
questions.correctAnswer: Triadic repetition
questions.explanation: The threefold questioning emphasizes restoration and commission, a triadic repetition common in biblical texts to underline importance (John 21:15-17).

questions.question: How does Jesus' command to 'Feed my sheep' in John 21:16 connect to Old Testament imagery?
options: It alludes to the shepherd-king motif
It recalls the prophets as shepherds
It is a unique New Testament phrase
questions.correctAnswer: It alludes to the shepherd-king motif
questions.explanation: The phrase echoes Old Testament shepherd imagery, such as David as shepherd-king and God's care for Israel, showing Peter’s pastoral role (John 21:16).

questions.question: What is the Greek meaning of the word 'Didymus' used for Thomas in John 21:2?
questions.correctAnswer: Twin
questions.explanation: 'Didymus' means 'twin' in Greek, indicating Thomas’s nickname or characteristic (John 21:2).

questions.question: John 21:14 states this was the third time Jesus showed Himself to the disciples after His resurrection. Which Gospel also emphasizes the number three in resurrection appearances?
questions.correctAnswer: None explicitly
questions.explanation: While John mentions three appearances, other Gospels do not explicitly number resurrection appearances as three, highlighting John's narrative distinctiveness (John 21:14).

questions.question: In John 21:18-19, Jesus predicts Peter will stretch forth his hands and be carried where he does not want. What is the deeper meaning of this prediction?
questions.correctAnswer: Peter’s martyrdom
questions.explanation: This foreshadows Peter’s future death by crucifixion, as stretching forth hands signifies being nailed to a cross (John 21:18-19).

questions.question: True or False: According to John 21:22, Jesus tells Peter that he should be concerned about what will happen to the disciple John.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Jesus tells Peter not to worry about John but to focus on following Him, indicating personal responsibility rather than concern for others (John 21:22).

questions.question: In John 21:11, the number of fish caught was 153. What is one proposed symbolic meaning of this number in biblical scholarship?
questions.correctAnswer: Represents all nations
questions.explanation: Some scholars suggest 153 symbolizes the totality of the known fish species or all nations, indicating the universality of the gospel (John 21:11).

questions.question: What does the term 'the disciple whom Jesus loved' signify in the context of John 21:7 and its broader Johannine usage?
questions.correctAnswer: John the Apostle
questions.explanation: Traditionally, this phrase identifies John the Apostle, highlighting his special relationship with Jesus and eyewitness testimony (John 21:7).

questions.question: In John 21:13, Jesus breaks bread and gives fish to the disciples. How does this act allude to Old Testament manna or covenantal meals?
options: It recalls the manna from heaven
questions.correctAnswer: It recalls the manna from heaven
questions.explanation: Providing bread and fish evokes God’s provision like manna in the wilderness, symbolizing sustenance and covenant relationship (John 21:13).

questions.question: According to John 21:24, who is believed to have written this Gospel?
questions.correctAnswer: The disciple whom Jesus loved
questions.explanation: The author identifies himself as the beloved disciple who testifies to these events, traditionally understood as John the Apostle (John 21:24).

questions.question: What is the cultural significance of the 'fire of coals' on the shore in John 21:9?
questions.correctAnswer: Common for cooking and warmth
questions.explanation: Fires were typical for cooking and warmth among fishermen, setting the scene for Jesus’ breakfast with the disciples (John 21:9).

questions.question: In John 21:23, the saying about the beloved disciple's death or survival became a source of controversy. What does this reveal about early Christian community concerns?
questions.correctAnswer: Speculation about Jesus' return
questions.explanation: The passage reflects early community interest in eschatology and the fate of key disciples, showing evolving interpretations of Jesus' promises (John 21:23).

questions.question: According to John 21:3, how did the disciples respond when Simon Peter said he was going fishing?
questions.correctAnswer: They went with him
questions.explanation: The disciples immediately decided to accompany Peter fishing, showing their close fellowship and shared livelihood (John 21:3).

theological.title: John Chapter 21 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from John Chapter 21 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What significant event does John 21 describe concerning Jesus and His disciples?
options: Jesus appears again to His disciples after His resurrection
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus appears again to His disciples after His resurrection
questions.explanation: John 21:1 explicitly states that Jesus showed Himself again to His disciples at the sea of Tiberias after His resurrection, affirming His bodily resurrection and continued relationship with His followers. This aligns with Luke 24:36-43 and 1 Corinthians 15:6, which also record post-resurrection appearances. Such appearances authenticate the resurrection and confirm Jesus’ victory over death, foundational to Christian faith.

questions.question: Which disciples were present together at the sea of Tiberias in John 21?
options: Simon Peter, Thomas, Nathanael, sons of Zebedee, and two others
questions.correctAnswer: Simon Peter, Thomas, Nathanael, sons of Zebedee, and two others
questions.explanation: John 21:2 lists the disciples present: Simon Peter, Thomas called Didymus, Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two other disciples. This group reflects the core followers who witnessed Jesus’ resurrection, consistent with Acts 1:13 which names similar apostles. Their presence underscores the continuity of Christ’s mission through His chosen apostles.

questions.question: Why did the disciples catch no fish during the night, according to John 21?
options: Because they had not yet obeyed Jesus’ instruction to cast the net on the right side
Because the fish had moved to another sea
Because they were not skilled fishermen
questions.correctAnswer: Because they had not yet obeyed Jesus’ instruction to cast the net on the right side
questions.explanation: John 21:3-6 shows that the disciples fished all night without success until Jesus told them to cast the net on the right side of the ship, resulting in a large catch. This reveals Jesus’ sovereign authority over creation (Psalm 104:25-26) and His role as the provider. It also symbolizes the new mission of the church to bring in the harvest (Matthew 4:19).

questions.question: How did the disciple whom Jesus loved identify Jesus to Peter?
options: He wrote His name in the sand
questions.correctAnswer: He said, 'It is the Lord'
questions.explanation: John 21:7 records that the disciple whom Jesus loved told Peter, 'It is the Lord.' This recognition emphasizes the intimate relationship between Jesus and the beloved disciple and highlights the importance of faith and spiritual discernment (1 John 2:3-6). It also foreshadows the role of testimony in the early church (Acts 1:8).

questions.question: What action did Simon Peter take immediately after realizing it was Jesus on the shore?
options: He girded his fisher's coat and cast himself into the sea
He ran to the other disciples
He bowed down and worshiped Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: He girded his fisher's coat and cast himself into the sea
questions.explanation: John 21:7 describes Simon Peter girding his fisher’s coat because he was naked and then jumping into the sea to reach Jesus. This action symbolizes Peter’s eagerness and restoration after his denial of Jesus (Luke 22:54-62). It also reflects the transformative power of the resurrection that renews discipleship (2 Corinthians 5:17).

questions.question: What was prepared on the shore for the disciples when they came to land?
options: A fire of coals, fish laid thereon, and bread
A feast of lamb and wine
A meal of unleavened bread and bitter herbs
A basket of fruits and water
questions.correctAnswer: A fire of coals, fish laid thereon, and bread
questions.explanation: John 21:9 mentions a fire of coals with fish and bread on the shore. This meal is reminiscent of Jesus’ provision and fellowship with His disciples, echoing the feeding miracles (John 6:9-13) and the Last Supper (Luke 22:19). It symbolizes communion and the sustenance Jesus provides for His followers spiritually and physically.

questions.question: How many fish did Simon Peter catch when he drew the net to the land?
questions.correctAnswer: One hundred and fifty-three
questions.explanation: John 21:11 records that Peter drew the net full of 153 fish, and the net was not broken. The precise number may symbolize the abundance of the Gentile and Jewish believers to be gathered (Jeremiah 16:16). It also reflects God’s providence and the fruitful mission of the church (Matthew 28:19-20).

questions.question: What command did Jesus give Peter after they had dined together?
options: Go and preach to the Gentiles
questions.correctAnswer: Feed my lambs and sheep
questions.explanation: John 21:15-17 shows Jesus commanding Peter three times to 'Feed my lambs' and 'Feed my sheep,' symbolizing pastoral care and leadership in the church (Ezekiel 34:11-16). This reinstates Peter after his denial and emphasizes the responsibility of shepherding God’s people according to Christ’s example (1 Peter 5:2-4).

questions.question: What does Jesus predict will happen to Peter in his old age?
options: He will be led where he does not want to go
He will live a long life of peace
He will become a wealthy fisherman
questions.correctAnswer: He will be led where he does not want to go
questions.explanation: John 21:18-19 predicts that Peter will be stretched out and another will lead him where he does not want to go, signifying his martyrdom. This prophecy aligns with early church tradition about Peter’s death and reflects the cost of faithful discipleship (Philippians 1:29; 2 Timothy 4:6-7). It shows Jesus’ foreknowledge and the glory that comes through suffering for God (Romans 8:17).

questions.question: How does Jesus respond when Peter asks about the fate of the disciple whom Jesus loved?
options: If I want him to remain until I come, what is that to you? Follow me
He will be the next leader of the church
questions.correctAnswer: If I want him to remain until I come, what is that to you? Follow me
questions.explanation: John 21:21-22 shows Jesus emphasizing individual calling and obedience, telling Peter that the beloved disciple’s destiny is not Peter’s concern. This underlines the sovereignty of God in matters of life and death (Deuteronomy 32:39), and calls believers to focus on their own discipleship (Matthew 16:24). It also guards against speculation about eschatology.

questions.question: What is the significance of the disciple whom Jesus loved according to the final verses of John 21?
options: He is the witness who testifies about these things and wrote this Gospel
He was the first to deny Jesus
He replaced Judas as the twelfth apostle
He was the only one who did not follow Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: He is the witness who testifies about these things and wrote this Gospel
questions.explanation: John 21:24 identifies the beloved disciple as the eyewitness and author of the Gospel, affirming the reliability and truthfulness of the testimony. This highlights the importance of apostolic witness and the inspiration of Scripture (2 Timothy 3:16; Luke 1:1-4). The Gospel’s historical accuracy supports Christian apologetics.

questions.question: What does the abundance of fish caught after Jesus’ command symbolize in a broader theological context?
options: The abundant harvest of souls in the kingdom of God
The failure of the disciples without Jesus
The scarcity of resources in the early church
The literal need for fish in Galilee
questions.correctAnswer: The abundant harvest of souls in the kingdom of God
questions.explanation: John 21:6-11 depicts a miraculous catch of fish after obeying Jesus, symbolizing the spiritual harvest of believers (Matthew 9:37-38). This demonstrates God’s providence and the mission to bring people into His kingdom, consistent with Old Testament imagery of gathering and restoration (Isaiah 9:3; Ezekiel 34:12).

questions.question: Why does Jesus ask Peter three times 'Do you love me?' in John 21?
options: To restore Peter after his three denials and commission him
To test Peter’s knowledge of Scripture
questions.correctAnswer: To restore Peter after his three denials and commission him
questions.explanation: John 21:15-17 shows Jesus asking Peter thrice if he loves Him, mirroring Peter’s three denials (Luke 22:61). This repetition functions as restoration and reaffirmation of Peter’s role in shepherding the church (Psalm 23; Ezekiel 34). It highlights God’s mercy and the call to faithful service despite past failure.

questions.question: What theological truth is exemplified by Jesus standing on the shore while the disciples fished without recognizing Him?
options: The post-resurrection Jesus is physically present yet sometimes spiritually unrecognized
Jesus no longer appears to His disciples
The disciples were not worthy to see Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: The post-resurrection Jesus is physically present yet sometimes spiritually unrecognized
questions.explanation: John 21:4 reveals that Jesus stood on the shore but the disciples did not know it was Him. This illustrates the mystery of the resurrection body and the spiritual blindness that can affect believers (Luke 24:16; 1 Corinthians 15:17). It underlines the need for revelation by the Spirit to recognize Christ (1 Corinthians 2:14).

questions.question: What eschatological implication is found in Jesus’ statement about the disciple who would 'tarry till I come'?
options: Jesus affirms His future return but leaves individual destinies uncertain
Jesus promises immortality to all disciples
Jesus specifies the time of the end
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus affirms His future return but leaves individual destinies uncertain
questions.explanation: John 21:22-23 shows Jesus acknowledging His return ('till I come') while deflecting questions about who will remain alive until then. This reflects biblical teaching on the uncertain timing of Christ’s return (Matthew 24:36; 1 Thessalonians 5:2) and emphasizes faithful obedience over speculation (Hebrews 10:25).
